meta.content: Governor Mike Parson ordered all Missouri public and charterÂ schools to remain closed through the remainder of the academic year. Administration will meet Monday, April 13, 2020, to discuss the end...

br.font: Governor Mike Parson ordered all Missouri public and charterÂ schools to remain closed through the remainder of the academic year. Administration will meet Monday, April 13, 2020, to discuss the end of the school year shutdown procedures regarding teachers and students, this includes collecting personal belongings. Please continue to monitor this page for more information as it becomes available. Wishing safety and health to our Hayti family during this time. Â
br.br:
Stay at home
Avoid crowds
Wash hands away from face
Sneeze into elbows
If experiencing symptoms, call doctor
Stay away from the elderly and those with compromised immune symptoms.
All extracurricular activitiesâ will be postponed until future notice; this includes athletic events, athletic practices and PROM. Â Additional information will be provided through school Facebook pages,local media, and school messenger.

br.font: âSENIORS needing to meet Graduation Requirements.

div.div: All seniors needing to finish graduation requirements in order to receive their diploma must complete and turn in the following assignments. This does not apply to the seniors that completed third quarter requirements.Â

img.style: float: left; position: relative; left: 0px; top: 0px; margin: 0 15px 15px 0; border: 0;

div.style: float: left; text-align: left; position: relative;

img.style: float: left; position: relative; left: 0px; top: 0px; margin: 0 15px 15px 0; border: 0;

div.style: float: left; text-align: left; position: relative;

font.span:
Â of the rubrics and create a project based off that rubric. The seniors should be familiar with this project, as we were working on it before our "break."
âplacherh@hayti.k12.mo.us

img.style: float: left; position: relative; left: 0px; top: 0px; margin: 0 15px 15px 0; border: 0;

div.style: float: left; text-align: left; position: relative;

div.font:
Seniors complete the answers on a Google Document and email it to me.Â speakesk@hayti.k12.mo.us
Give the title of each worksheet and the answers on each page.
11th and 10th Graders needing to meet Requirements.

div.span: All 11th and 10th graders needing to finish requirements in order to meet their credit requirements must turn in the following assignments. This does not apply to the students that completed third quarter requirements.

div.font: Everett - The work for failing ACT Prep students can be accessed on USA Test Prep.Â If students are unable to access it or do not remember login information, they can email me at everettm@hayti.k12.mo.us

div.span: 9th, 8th, and 7th Graders needing to meet Requirements.

All 9th, 8th, and 7th graders needing to finish requirements in order to meet their credit requirements must turn in the following assignments. This does not apply to the students that completed third quarter requirements.

img.style: float: left; position: relative; left: 0px; top: 0px; margin: 0 15px 15px 0; border: 0;

div.style: float: left; text-align: left; position: relative;

div.div:
Parents and Students:
Starting, Tuesday, March 31, 2020, we will only have one food delivery route per day, at the same designated areas. They will now start delivering at 10:30am. During this time students will be given their lunch for that day and a breakfast for the following day. This will continue until Â further notice.

img.style: float: left; position: relative; left: 0px; top: 0px; margin: 0 15px 15px 0; border: 0;

div.style: float: left; text-align: left; position: relative;

font.span: All of Mrs. Rodgers' dual credit studentsÂ

Â work in order to receive college credit. All work has been or will be put on google classrooms. You can access google classroom on your phones. If you need paper copies, you can pick the packets up at Hayti High School. There will be a box to return work to as well. Your work has to be graded no exceptions. You will have an open book final during the week of May 11. If you have any questions, please contact Mrs. Rodgers at rodgerst@hayti.k12.mo.us.
â

span.font: Please add that DC biology will have zoom meeting at 1:00 p.m. on Tuesday and Thursday and DC Chemistry will have zoom meetings at 2:00 p.m. on Tuesday and Thursday. The links can be found in their google classroom and you can attend the meeting using your phone.

em.strong: Classwork for the extended break - COVID-19

br.font: These assignments will begin March 30,2020, while on extended break due to COVID-19. Also, educational packets will be available for pick-up - Â designated times 8am - 10am Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays.
